intro: Corydalis linjiangensis, commonly known as the Linjiang Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in rocky or forested areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
